title: Your honest opinion; should this has been a yellow card?

author: Elizasol
text:
How is it on a futbol subreddit 50% of people don't even know the basic rules of the game....


> cautions (YCs) for offences relating to ‘inappropriate’ behaviour, e.g.

> • Simulation
> • Deliberately delaying the opposing team’s restart of the match

> • Dissent or verbal comments or gestures

>   • ***Stopping or interfering with a promising attack by holding, pulling, pushing or handball***

> • Kicker illegally feinting at a penalty kick

A handball without interfering with a promising attack, **is just a foul**.

author: OldDutchFlinch
text: Because they never bothered to read them. It's actually amazing how often the television commentators get them wrong,  and it's their full time job

author: Fast_Chicken4636
text: You’re explaining something to stones, even if you try they just won’t understand

author: payinthefidlr
text:
You're arguing semantics here and also ignoring the catch-all misconduct category of 'unsporting behavior' which this falls under.

But regardless of all that, as anyone whose watched football for long enough should know,  the words in the rule book do not always reflect the way that the game is actually officiated, and in fact consistency and existing precedent are the prevailing philosophies most refs use. To claim this is not a clear yellow is to ignore established precedent, regardless of whatever bureaucratic, technical argument you want to make

author: Elizasol
text:
Ahh yes, my "bureaucratic technical argument" aka the rules of the sport.

This was not a yellow card foul, time to move on

author: payinthefidlr
text: Ooo dogma, my favorite way to escape an argument

author: Elizasol
text: Your argument has no basis in reality and is just your perception, which I believe is influenced by your bias. The referee's job is to enforce the rules. The rules are clear. What happened in this instance was not a yellow card foul. Move on

author: payinthefidlr
text:
More dogma.  As my response copy and paste your reply except get rid of the word "not".

It's funny how easy debate is when you can just say things like they're facts

author: Elizasol
text: Yeah, that's what the rules are, facts.

author: payinthefidlr
text: But we're not debating what the words are, that's in ink.  We're debating the *interpretation*. To conflate the two is disingenuous and antisocratic

author: Elizasol
text:
You're just crying because I won't engage you in your terrible argument. The rules are set. The referee enforces them. The play is not worthy of a YC according to those rules. Nothing you say will change any of those facts.

Your team lost or the team you wanted to lose won, learn to move on with your life, the referee made the right call.
